title: Virtual Reality-Based Safety Skills Training: For Adolescents with Autism Spectrum and Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Customized educational program for youth with disabilities preparing to enter medical/legal/technical fields

learning_goals: Learners can identify risk scenarios (traffic accidents, abduction, fires, etc.) in a virtual reality environment and execute response strategies with over 80% accuracy.
Learners practice safety behavior patterns with over 90% consistency using real-time feedback from animated characters.
Demonstrate behavioral change by applying learned safety skills in real-world environments at least 70% of the time
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
